definitions.definition: A pupil who lives at school during term time.
definitions.example: The student body consisted primarily of boarders, except for a few children belonging to the school staff.

definitions.definition: Someone who pays for meals and lodging in a house rather than a hotel.
definitions.example: When I left for college, my parents took on a boarder in my old room to help defray expenses.

definitions.definition: One who boards a vehicle.
A sailor attacking an enemy ship by boarding her, or one repelling such attempts by an enemy.
definitions.example: The captain shouted at the crew to grab arms and repel boarders.

definitions.definition: Someone who takes part in a boardsport, such as surfing or snowboarding.
definitions.example: A group of boarders swept past us as we climbed the side of the ski run.

definitions.definition: Of political ideologies: favoring political and social equality.
Sad or discouraged, especially as indicated by one's facial appearance.
A repository on a computer network where people can post messages, usually about a single subject.
To procrastinate; to take a long time before doing something or taking a decision.
definitions.example: We hummed and hawed before finally deciding to buy this house.

definitions.definition: An act of striking with a beak.
A small kiss.
To strike or pierce with the beak or bill (of a bird).
definitions.example: The birds pecked at their food.

definitions.definition: To form by striking with the beak or a pointed instrument.
definitions.example: to peck a hole in a tree

definitions.definition: To strike, pick, thrust against, or dig into, with a pointed instrument, especially with repeated quick movements.
To seize and pick up with the beak, or as if with the beak; to bite; to eat; often with up.
To do something in small, intermittent pieces.
definitions.example: He has been pecking away at that project for some time now.

definitions.definition: To type by searching for each key individually.
To type in general.
To kiss briefly.
One quarter of a bushel; a dry measure of eight quarts.
definitions.example: They picked a peck of wheat.

definitions.definition: A great deal; a large or excessive quantity.
definitions.example: She figured most children probably ate a peck of dirt before they turned ten.

definitions.definition: To throw.
To lurch forward; especially, of a horse, to stumble after hitting the ground with the toe instead of the flat of the foot.
Discoloration caused by fungus growth or insects.
definitions.example: an occurrence of peck in rice

definitions.definition: Drab; dark, colorless, or cheerless.
definitions.example: It had rained for three days straight, and the dreary weather dragged the townspeople's spirits down.

definitions.definition: Grievous, dire; appalling.
A person holding a rank in the RAF, between that of pilot officer and flight lieutenant, equivalent to an Army lieutenant or Royal Navy sublieutenant
A religion in which rules exist to govern the means by which adherents participate in the religion.
A hairstyle characterized by a tightly curled locks and a rounded shape.
Initialism of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender/transsexual (community).
(chiefly in the plural) A member of the LGBT community.
definitions.example: 2018 Disgraced former Fox News host Bill O’Reilly claims ‘the LGBTs’ are trying to rid America of white men Pink News

definitions.definition: Nauseous due to the effects of motion of an airplane; suffering from motion sickness caused by air travel.
A small, fast antelope native to southern Africa, Antidorcas marsupialis.
A player of the batting side now on the field.
The player now receiving strike; the striker.
Any player selected for his or her team principally to bat, as opposed to a bowler.
Any of the above senses, restricted to male players.
(now rare) A hitter.
Any of several trees, genus Durio, of Southeast Asia.
The spiky edible fruit of this tree, known for its strong taste and very strong, unpleasant odor.
A yellow colour, like that of durian flesh (also called durian yellow).
An intersection with a circular shape and, usually, a central island
A child safety seat that raises the vertical position of the user to allow a safer use of regular car seat belts.
A central room or space in ancient Roman homes, open to the sky in the middle; a similar space in other buildings.
A square hall lit by daylight from above, into which rooms open at one or more levels.
A cavity, entrance, or passage.
Any enclosed sexine and nexine layers, widening toward the interior of the grain.
One who pitches anything, as hay, quoits, a ball, etc.
, the player who delivers the ball to the batter.
The top partner in a homosexual relationship or penetrator in a sexual encounter between two men.
A sort of crowbar for digging.
A wide-mouthed, deep vessel for holding liquids, with a spout or protruding lip and a handle; a water jug or jar with a large ear or handle.
A tubular or cuplike appendage or expansion of the leaves of certain plants. See pitcher plant.
A representation of anything (as a person, a landscape, a building) upon canvas, paper, or other surface, by drawing, painting, printing, photography, etc.
An image; a representation as in the imagination.
A painting.
definitions.example: There was a picture hanging above the fireplace.

definitions.definition: A photograph.
definitions.example: I took a picture of the church.

definitions.definition: A motion picture.
definitions.example: Casablanca is my all-time favorite picture.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) ("the pictures") Cinema (as a form of entertainment).
definitions.example: Let's go to the pictures.

definitions.definition: A paragon, a perfect example or specimen (of a category).
definitions.example: She's the very picture of health.

definitions.definition: An attractive sight.
definitions.example: The garden is a real picture at this time of year.

definitions.definition: The art of painting; representation by painting.
A figure; a model.
Situation.
definitions.example: The employment picture for the older middle class is not so good.

definitions.definition: Used to move or return to another subject of discussion.
definitions.example: Now then, what shall we do?

definitions.definition: A mild admonishment.
definitions.example: Now then, don't hit your brother!

definitions.definition: A greeting.
definitions.example: Now then, John, what you up to?

definitions.definition: To travel from island to island in a certain area, especially as a tourist to visit numerous islands.
Someone who performs a puja, especially a priest in a Hindu temple.
To serve.
definitions.example: They service the customer base.

definitions.definition: To perform maintenance.
definitions.example: He is going to service the car.

definitions.definition: To inseminate through sexual intercourse
To perform a sexual act.
definitions.example: He was going to service her.

definitions.definition: The act of performing maintenance on something.
definitions.example: How many servicings has your car had this year?

definitions.definition: The act of commemorating; an observance or celebration to honor the memory of some person or event.
That which serves the purpose of commemorating; a memorial.
The specification of individual saints in the prayers for the dead; the great festival of the Oxford academic year, usually taking place on the third Wednesday after Trinity Sunday.
A political struggle for control over cultural institutions.
(often in plural) Conflict between different ideological groups, especially political conflict for cultural dominance between liberals and conservatives in the United States.
To explode; to blow up. Specifically, to combust supersonically via shock compression.
To cause to explode.
A vessel for boiling a liquid or cooking food, usually metal and equipped with a lid.
definitions.example: There's a hot kettle of soup on the stove.

definitions.definition: The quantity held by a kettle.
A vessel for boiling water for tea.
definitions.example: Stick the kettle on and we'll have a nice cup of tea.

definitions.definition: A kettle hole, sometimes any pothole.
(collective) A group of raptors riding a thermal, especially when migrating.
definitions.example: a kettle of hawks

definitions.definition: A steam locomotive
A kettledrum.
An instance of kettling; a group of protesters or rioters confined in a limited area.
(of the police) To contain demonstrators in a confined area.
A kind of fishweir resembling a wattle or fence.
To move or develop something.
To exert or experience force.
(fluidic) To remove or separate or displace.
To change in size or shape.
To attract or be attracted.
(usually as draw on or draw upon) To rely on; utilize as a source.
definitions.example: She had to draw upon her experience to solve the problem.

definitions.definition: To disembowel.
To end a game in a draw (with neither side winning).
definitions.example: We drew last time we played.  I drew him last time I played him.  I drew my last game against him.

definitions.definition: To choose by means of a random selection process.
To make a shot that lands gently in the house (the circular target) without knocking out other stones.
To play (a short-length ball directed at the leg stump) with an inclined bat so as to deflect the ball between the legs and the wicket.
To hit (the ball) with the toe of the club so that it is deflected toward the left.
To strike (the cue ball) below the center so as to give it a backward rotation which causes it to take a backward direction on striking another ball.
Appearing tired and unwell, as from stress; haggard.
Of a game: undecided; having no definite winner and loser.
A kick in which the attacker swings his/her leg around in a semicircular motion, striking with the front of the leg or foot.
An institution which provides all or part of secondary education.
Secondary school
A very large meal, often of a ceremonial nature.
definitions.example: We had a feast to celebrate the harvest.

definitions.definition: Something delightful
definitions.example: It was a feast for the eyes.

definitions.definition: A festival; a holy day or holiday; a solemn, or more commonly, a joyous, anniversary.
To partake in a feast, or large meal.
definitions.example: I feasted on turkey and dumplings.

definitions.definition: To dwell upon (something) with delight.
To hold a feast in honor of (someone).
definitions.example: We feasted them after the victory.

definitions.definition: To serve as a feast for; to feed sumptuously.
A style of humor marked by broad improbabilities with little regard to regularity or method.
A motion picture or play featuring this style of humor.
definitions.example: The farce that we saw last night had us laughing and shaking our heads at the same time.

definitions.definition: A situation abounding with ludicrous incidents.
definitions.example: The first month of labor negotiations was a farce.

definitions.definition: A ridiculous or empty show.
definitions.example: The political arena is a mere farce, with all sorts of fools trying to grab power.

definitions.definition: Forcemeat, stuffing.
To stuff with forcemeat.
To fill full; to stuff.
To make fat.
To swell out; to render pompous.
Cross-country skiing, especially as competitive sport.
Nordic skiing, including cross-country skiing, biathlon, ski jumping.
A chair with a curved base which can be gently rocked (swung) back and forth.
A genre of popular music that evolved in the 1950s from a combination of rhythm and blues and country music, characterized by electric guitars, strong rhythms, and youth-oriented lyrics.
A style of vigorous dancing associated with this genre of music.

An intangible feeling, philosophy, belief or allegiance relating to rock music (generally from the 1970s–1980s), and heavy metal bearing certain elements of this music, pertaining to unbridled enthusiasm, cynical regard for certain Christian and authoritarian bodies, and attitudes befitting some degree of youthful debauchery. This meaning is sometimes used as an exclamation, in describing traits of certain people, and so on.
The full automatic fire capability selection on a selective fire weapon.
(1920s) To have sex.
To play rock and roll music.
To start, commence, begin, get moving.
definitions.example: Does everyone know what car they're going in? Then let's rock and roll!

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to karma.
The act of contravening a rule, regulation, or law, or of not fulfilling an obligation, promise, or agreement.
definitions.example: Their contravention of the treaty increased international tensions.

definitions.definition: (of a person) Pleasing or attractive to the eye.
definitions.example: a comely woman

definitions.definition: Suitable or becoming; proper; agreeable.
A public spectacle, in Spain and some other Latin countries, in which a person baits and often kills a bull.
A young or little cow; calf.
To cover with, or as if with, a cowl (hood).
To wrap or form (something made of fabric) like a cowl.
To make a monk of (a person).
A removable protective covering for the engine of an aircraft, motorcycle etc
To provide informational feedback to.
definitions.example: His employees fed back a lot more than he wanted.

definitions.definition: To convey by means of specialized communications channel.
definitions.example: Customers fed back their complaints and some praise.

definitions.definition: A soft drink or a soda with an orange flavor.
A mixture of soda water and orange juice.
Orange juice, see also orange.
(of a voice) Hoarse and rough-sounding.
Burly, stout.
Abounding with husks; consisting of husks.
Any of several breeds of dogs used as sled dogs.
To make progress or obtain advantage.
definitions.example: No matter how hard I try, I don't seem to be gaining ground.

definitions.definition: To order, give orders; to compel or direct with authority.
definitions.example: The king commanded his servant to bring him dinner.

definitions.definition: To have or exercise supreme power, control or authority over, especially military; to have under direction or control.
definitions.example: to command an army or a ship

definitions.definition: To require with authority; to demand, order, enjoin.
definitions.example: he commanded silence

definitions.definition: To dominate through ability, resources, position etc.; to overlook.
definitions.example: Bridges commanded by a fortified house. (Motley.)

definitions.definition: To exact, compel or secure by influence; to deserve, claim.
definitions.example: A good magistrate commands the respect and affections of the people.

definitions.definition: To hold, to control the use of.
definitions.example: The fort commanded the bay.

definitions.definition: To have a view, as from a superior position.
To direct to come; to bestow.
The act of giving a command.
Tending to give commands, authoritarian.
Impressively dominant.
definitions.example: a commanding structure

definitions.definition: (of a place or position) Dominating from above, giving a wide view
A large (usually rectangular) piece of luggage used for carrying clothes, and sometimes suits, when travelling.
To trade using samples in a suitcase.
To smuggle in one's rectum.
A childish or youthful infatuation with another person.
definitions.example: They're only teenagers; it's hard to take their puppy love seriously.

definitions.definition: A positively charged ion, i.e. one that would be attracted to the cathode in electrolysis.
A dessert made of fruit cooked in sugary syrup.
A dish used for serving fruit.
Paralysis from the neck down
Paralysis of all four limbs
To engage in conflict (may be followed by "with" to specify the foe).
To carry on, as a contest; to wage.
The act of engaging in war or conflict.
Engaged in war; belligerent
A second-year undergraduate student in a college or university, or a second-year student in a four-year secondary school or high school.
definitions.example: She was very mature for a sophomore and had several friends who were juniors or even seniors.

definitions.definition: A three-year-old horse.
definitions.example: The filly had looked promising as a sophomore, but concerns over her health had prompted the owner to pull her from the season’s early races.

definitions.definition: The second in a series, especially, the second of an artist’s albums or the second of four years in a high school (tenth grade) or university.
definitions.example: The band’s sophomore album built upon the success of their debut release, catapulting them to megastardom.

definitions.definition: Sophomoric.
The reporting of news, especially by an eyewitness.
News or information that has been reported; media coverage of a topic or event.
Information supplied in a report.
To launch into an animated diatribe, or passionate description or explanation of something.
definitions.example: I barely mentioned the band's name before he went off on one about how commercial the top forty is these days.

definitions.definition: An inexpensive supervised lodging place, primarily for young people.
A pasta of North African origin made of crushed and steamed semolina.
Any of several herbivorous, burrowing marsupials, of the family Vombatidae, mainly found in southern and eastern Australia.
A minor role, generally not assigned a name.
definitions.example: 2005, Most of her work, however, consisted of bit parts. She often was cast in movies credited only as "flower vendor," "warden" or "suntan lady," — 'Five Easy Pieces' waitress dead at 85, CNN online.

definitions.definition: Having a physical, tangible body; material, corporeal.
Of or pertaining to the body, especially the human body; bodily.
definitions.example: corporal punishment

definitions.definition: Pertaining to the body (the thorax and abdomen), as distinguished from the head, limbs and wings, etc.
A non-commissioned officer army rank with NATO code OR-4. The rank below a sergeant but above a lance corporal and private.
A non-commissioned officer rank in the police force, below a sergeant but above a private or patrolman.
A worker in charge of the wagonway, reporting to the deputy.
The white linen cloth on which the elements of the Eucharist are placed; a communion cloth.
Fermented green forage fodder stored in a silo.
To ensilage.
The amount that a baby weighs at the time of birth.
definitions.example: Premature infants often have a very low birthweight.

definitions.definition: A clam of several species in superfamily Solenoidea, with long curved shells resembling straight razors.
A clothesline
A major league.
Major league (pertaining to the highest level of professional sports).
definitions.example: He made a real big league play.

definitions.definition: Major league (significant, important).
To a significant degree; on a large scale.
Of or pertaining to an amicable, kindly disposition.
To injure or obstruct intentionally.
To gain influence by corrupt means or intimidation.
definitions.example: The jury was nobbled to delay unanimous verdict.

definitions.definition: To steal.
To tamper (typically with a racehorse) in order to prevent from winning a race
Not under control.
definitions.example: Clean things as you go so that the mess does not get out of hand.

definitions.definition: Without (further) thought or consideration.
Immediately, forthwith, or incontinently.
To distribute
The southern region of certain US states, particularly Michigan, New York, and Illinois.
definitions.example: The final election returns from downstate may not be available until late Wednesday morning.

definitions.definition: Of the southern section of a state.
To the southern section of a state.
A strip of leather.
(usually in the plural) An item of footwear, usually of rubber, secured by two straps which join to pass between the big toe and its neighbour.
An undergarment or swimwear consisting of very narrow strips designed to cover just the genitals and nothing more.
definitions.example: No! I won't buy you a thong. You're too young for that.

definitions.definition: The largest section of a bullwhip constructed of many straps of braided leather.
In mammals, a sheet of muscle separating the thorax from the abdomen, contracted and relaxed in respiration to draw air into and expel air from the lungs; also called thoracic diaphragm.
Any of various membranes or sheets of muscle or ligament which separate one cavity from another.
A contraceptive device consisting of a flexible cup, used to cover the cervix during intercourse.
A flexible membrane separating two chambers and fixed around its periphery that distends into one or other chamber as the difference in the pressure in the chambers varies.
(acoustics) In a speaker, the thin, semi-rigid membrane which vibrates to produce sound.
A thin opaque structure with a central aperture, used to limit the passage of light into a camera or similar device.
A permeable or semipermeable membrane.
A floor slab, metal wall panel, roof panel or the like, having a sufficiently large in-plane shear stiffness and sufficient strength to transmit horizontal forces to resisting systems.
To reduce lens aperture using an optical diaphragm.
To act as a diaphragm, for example by vibrating.
A zone between the defensive line of scrimmage and the offensive line of scrimmage.
A zone on the playing surface between the attacking zone and the defending zone as delineated by the two blue lines.
A non-competitive segment of a bicycle race during which competitors have to stay behind the lead vehicles.
A crayfish or lobster.
Crazy.
A viscous, sweet fluid produced from plant nectar by bees. Often used to sweeten tea or to spread on baked goods.
A variety of this substance.
Nectar.
Something sweet or desirable.
A term of affection.
definitions.example: Honey, I'm home.

definitions.definition: A woman, especially an attractive one.
definitions.example: Man, there are some fine honeys here tonight!

definitions.definition: A spectrum of pale yellow to brownish-yellow colour, like that of most types of (the sweet substance) honey.
To sweeten; to make agreeable.
To be gentle, agreeable, or coaxing; to talk fondly; to use endearments.
To be or become obsequiously courteous or complimentary; to fawn.
Involving or resembling honey.
Of a pale yellow to brownish-yellow colour, like most types of honey.
Any of several forms of church organization in which each congregation is responsible for its own government.
A sky-blue, greenish-blue, or greenish-gray semi-precious gemstone.
A pale greenish-blue colour, like that of the gemstone.
Made of turquoise (the gemstone).
Having a pale greenish-blue colour.
The duration during which a radio or television program (or part of one) is transmitted.
definitions.example: Can you get me some airtime for my latest single?

definitions.definition: The chargeable use of a mobile phone, either in minutes or in units dependent on the use or traffic.
The period during which a person riding a rollercoaster or similar ride experiences a feeling of weightlessness.
The lower classes in society
A predefined route, or series of routes, in which a commercial or military aircraft must fly.
